snippet: Brian Matusz, whose 10.69 earned run average last season was the highest in history for a pitcher with at least 10 starts, trained under Brady Anderson in the off-season to get stronger.
abstract: Tyler Kepner On Baseball column profiles Baltimore Orioles pitcher Brian Matusz, whose 10.69 earned run average last season was the highest in history for a pitcher with at least 10 starts; notes that Matusz trained under Orioles conditioning consultant Brady Anderson in the off-season to get stronger.
lead_paragraph: Brian Matusz, whose 10.69 earned run average last season was the highest in history for a pitcher with at least 10 starts, trained under Brady Anderson in the off-season to get stronger.

headline.seo: Orioles’ Matusz Builds a Stronger Foundation
headline.main: Not the Kind of Mark a Pitcher Wants
headline.print_headline: Not the Kind of Mark A Pitcher Wants
